description.narrative: The project shall facilitate a transformative shift from unsustainable to integrated sustainable land management in Mount Elgon landscape to prevent land degradation and reduce risks of natural disasters.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

Output 2 2.1.1 Establish 66 FFS (1 per parish) using the appropriate approaches approach 2.1.2 Support the development and implementation of at least six bye-laws at Sub county level to implement strategies on SLM, SFM and CCM 2.1.3 Support the Catchment Management Committees, CBOs and relevant Local Councils to implement and monitor LUPs at Parish level 2.2.1: Participatory elaboration of an action plan to improve and strengthen existing collaboration between national institutions , local governments, the private and social sectors and individual farmers to improve farmers access to inputs technical support and advice, and markets 2.2.2 Support Enterprise Based Farmer to Farmer Learning visits 2.3.1: Set up conservation agriculture demonstration plots covering 300 ha in the 6 selected sub-counties. 2.3.2: Support rehabilitation of degraded areas using ILM in 6 sub counties 2.3.3: Strengthening agro- forestry practices for ILM in 6 sub counties 2.3.4: Support monitoring of 33 Community Based Organizations and on-ground Landscape activities on 25,500 ha. 2.4.3: Implementing the monitoring frameworks by the key selected actors in relation to GEF Land degradation monitoring requirements. 2.4.4 Conduct training in GIS for technical persons in districts 2.4.5 Develop a repository and management center (database) for land use data. Busitema University to liaise with all relevant Responsible Partners to align the maps to the physical planning Act and Land Use Planning laws 2.5.1: Document project best practices and lessons learned and suggest up-scaling strategies 2.5.2: Publish the success stories and lessons learnt arising from the project interventions 2.5.3 Disseminate and support implementation of the monitoring and enforcement framework for legislative clauses on CCM, SLM, SFM

Output 2 2.1.1 Fifteen (15) FFS facilitators were trained and development of FFS is on-going 2.1.2 Six (6) bye-laws were developed to facilitate legislation around SLM, SFM and CCM within the 6 sub-counties of the project area. 2.1.3 Catchment Management Committees, 33 CBOs and Local Councils at district level were supported through capacity building initiatives, to implement and monitor LUPs at Parish level 2.2.1 An action plan to improve and strengthen existing collaboration with NARO, and Busitema University was drawn. In addition, the sustainability action plan for engagement of CBOs in SLM and SFM was drawn. 2.2.2 Two (2) Enterprise Based Farmer to Farmer Learning visits in country, and one (1) South to South Farmers visit to Kenya. Several technologies were adopted to improve the land utilization particularly on water harvesting. 2.3.1 Conservation agriculture demonstration plots covering 343 ha were established in the 6 selected sub-counties. 2.3.2 Rehabilitation of degraded areas using ILM technologies including grass, contour and stone bands to stop soil erosion, planting 40Ha of woodlots, 330Ha put under agroforestry, establishing 566 energy saving stoves and hedge rows with organic and inorganic fertilizers to improve soil fertility. 2.3.4 Monitoring frameworks for soil erosion and carbon stocks were used by technical officers at district level to monitor LD as required by GEF. 2.4.4 GIS training was carried for 32 technical staff in the 3 districts (20M, 12F). 2.4.5 Geo-referencing of existing land use plans and supportive features was done resulting into development of a spatial database as a repository for all land use plans that will greatly support in effective monitoring of the LUPs. 2.5.1 Project best practices and lessons learned have not been documented explicitly and up-scaling strategies not yet well elaborated. 2.5.3 Legislative clauses on CCM, SLM, SFM were disseminated and communities challenged to generate the enforcement strategies.
